dmca.title: IFPI DMCA (Copyright) Complaint to Google
dmca.body:
31 July 2012 Google, Inc Blogger Legal Support, DMCA Complaints 1600 Amphitheatre Parkway Mountain View, CA 94043 Attn: Blogger Legal Support, DMCA Complaints Email: [redacted]google.com Ref: http://www.ludovico-2810.blogspot.com.es Re: (Links attached) Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to you on behalf of the International Federation of the Phonographic Industry (IFPI) and the record companies it represents, in relation to a Blogger website hosted by Google at http://www.ludovico-2810.blogspot.com.es ("the identified Blogger Site"). IFPI believes the Identified Blogger Site is primarily dedicated to copyright infringement in a manner that violate's Google's terms of service. We attach a spreadsheet, for your review, which sets out multiple URLs from the Identified Blogger Site that make available reproductions of sound recordings owned or exclusively controlled by certain IFPI member companies, without those companies' authorisation. We ask that you immediately terminate the hosting of the Identified Blogger Site, in accordance with Google's terms of service. As you know, IFPI is a trade association that represents over 1,400 major and independent record companies in the US and internationally who create, manufacture and distribute sound recordings (the "IFPI Represented Companies"). IFPI is authorized to act on behalf of the IFPI Represented Companies in matters involving the infringement of their sound recordings, including enforcing their copyrights and common law rights on the Internet. IFPI's top priority is to prevent the continued availability of the IFPI Represented Companies' content on the internet. Unauthorized copies of sound recordings that are freely available, especially pre-release recordings, cause substantial damage to the IFPI Represented Companies every hour and day they remain available. In making this communication we are seeking to ensure that infringing content is removed from the internet as quickly as possible through your cooperation. However, please note that we do not admit that we or the IFPI Represented Companies are responsible for detecting infringing material and notifying you of it. Please also note that this communication does not constitute a waiver of any right to recover damages incurred by virtue of the unauthorised activities described in it. Such rights, as well as claims for other relief are hereby expressly reserved. You may contact me at IFPI Secretariat, [redacted], London W1J 0DD, United Kingdom or email [redacted]ifpi.org, to discuss this communication. We await your response. Yours faithfully [redacted] Director, Internet Anti-Piracy IFPI [redacted] London W1J 0DD United Kingdom Email: [redacted]ifpi.org
